etymology.description: Depicts a long river with tributaries -> horizontal flip of 永(永) (yǒng, "forever")
etymology.interpretation: The character 𠂢 represents a flowing river, indicating movement or continuity similar to the concept of 永(永) (yǒng, "forever") but depicted in horizontal orientation. This pictogram captures the visual imagery of waterways branching off a main river.

examples.chinese: 古代文献中(古代文獻中)，𠂢作为原始形态保存下来(𠂢作為原始形態保存下來)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài wénxiàn zhōng, mǐ zuòwéi yuánshǐ xíngtài bǎocún xiàlái.
examples.english: In ancient texts, 𠂢 is preserved in its original form.

examples.chinese: 这幅书法作品体现了𠂢的原始美(這幅書法作品體現了𠂢的原始美)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè fú shūfǎ zuòpǐn tǐxiàn le mǐ de yuánshǐ měi.
examples.english: This calligraphy work reflects the original beauty of 𠂢.
